item.title: AKA/SND - Passing the Red Giant [Ambient, Synth]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks

Trey:

the snap sounded like it was like a 32nd before the other melody

I purposely put it in an off-(off-)beat*. I wanted it to simply feel like a sound in the loop, with the same pacing, but outside the main (sense of) rhythm, rather than a percussive instrument - to avoid it taking the role of a snare or a clap, or a pulse starting each bar.

By putting it where it is, (imo) it gives the loop a more abstracted, organic foundation. Rhythmic, but not percussion, per se.

* It’s actually on 9of24th step, while all other parts use the standard 16ths pattern. It’s a pretty awkward (syncopation) slot, if you’re trying to discern the ‘1 and 2 and 3 and…’ rhythm. It’s one of the reasons I chose it and like it.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA/SND - Passing the Red Giant [Ambient, Synth]
item.dc:creator: Trey
item.description:
I like this it’s pretty cool. One thing that I noticed was that the snap sounded like it was like a 32nd before the other melody. I felt it didn’t fit until the atom (or igloo I’m not sure) instrument came in which took a while. Other than that everything seemed to fit in place and balanced pretty well.

item.title: AKA/SND - Passing the Red Giant [Ambient, Synth]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
So, finally spent some putting the finishing* touches to an ambient piece that I toyed with a few months ago…

(* ‘Auxy finished’)

 
Headphones on – and clickity-click…
AKA/SND - Passing the Red Giant (5:28)

 
Grateful, as always, for any thoughts, feedback and pointers you care to share.
